text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
IRM 25.15.7 has been revised to update information, and provide guidance for coordination between Cincinnati Centralized Innocent Spouse Operations (CCISO) and other functions of the Service.
MATERIAL CHANGES
IRM 25.15.7.1 - Incorporated applicable internal control information, title changed to “Program Scope and Objectives”, and included information from prior version of 25.15.7.1.

EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
Employees within the Compliance Campus Functions and Cincinnati Centralized Innocent Spouse Operations (CCISO) who work cases involving innocent spouse issues.

Shared Processing Responsibilities
) Purpose: This IRM provides guidance for IRS employees considering spouse relief requests where coordination with other functions is required. (

) Audience: Small Business/Self Employed (SB/SE) employees within the pliance Campus Functions and Cincinnati Centralized Innocent Spouse Operations (CCISO) who work cases involving innocent spouse issues. (
) Policy Owner: The policy owner is the SB/SE Director, Examination - Field Campus Policy. (
) Program Owner: The program owner is SB/SE Campus Exam and Field Support. (
) Program Goals: The program goals are to properly coordinate processing innocent spouse relief requests when other account conditions are (

) Requests for relief from joint and several liabilities are centralized at the cinnati IRS Campus known as the Cincinnati Centralized Innocent Spouse Operation (CCISO). Requests can be received in other operations. (

) This IRM contains general information related to shared responsibilities • Accounts Maintenance (AM). • Campus Correspondence Examination Operation/Automated porter Operations (CCEO/AUR). • Collection (which is further broken down into): Bankruptcy, Due Process (CDP), Offer In Compromise (OIC). • Small Business/Self Employed (SB/SE) Field Examination. • Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS). • Tax Court/Appeals. Innocent Spouse Shared Processing Responsibilities 25.15.7
Purpose: This IRM provides guidance for IRS employees considering innocent spouse relief requests where coordination with other functions is required.
Program Goals: The program goals are to properly coordinate processing of innocent spouse relief requests when other account conditions are present.
• Small Business/Self Employed (SB/SE) Field Examination. • Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS). • Tax Court/Appeals. IRC
, Treatment of Community Income.

) The Director, Examination - Field and Campus Policy, reports to the Headquarters Examination, and is responsible for the delivery of policy and guidance that impacts the ﬁeld and campus examination process. See IRM
, Field and Campus Policy, for additional information. (

) Campus Exam and Field Support, which is under the Director, Examination Field and Campus Policy, is the group responsible for providing policy guidance on compliance processes that relate to campus operations and support Field Exam and Specialty Programs in SB/SE and Large Business & International (LB&I). See IRM
, Campus and Field Support, for additional information. (
) CCISO falls under the responsibility of the Director, Examination - Campus, with the Director, Examination - Field and Campus Policy, providing to the innocent spouse processing IRMs. (
) The IRS formally adopted a Taxpayer Bill of Rights (TBOR) in June
Congress charged the Commissioner with ensuring IRS employees responsible for being familiar with and acting in accordance with taxpayer rights. See IRC
), Execution of Duties in Accord with Taxpayer Rights. For additional information about the TBOR, see Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) at Taxpayer Bill of Rights FAQs. (

) Management officials in CCISO are responsible for ensuring that established for considering requests for innocent spouse relief are followed CCISO employees. Activities include creating and updating the Innocent Spouse Tracking System (ISTS) records, creating and maintaining cases the Accounts Management System (AMS)/Innocent Spouse Application Database, and making account adjustments needed to properly reﬂect the termination of relief or resolve complex account issues when requests for are non-qualifying. Management uses reports generated through IDRS, and AMS to account for cases within the operation, and measure program fectiveness. (

) Policy does program reviews periodically on CCISO to evaluate whether procedures comply with the IRM and to do risk analysis to identify possible process improvements. Operational reviews are conducted periodically by Director, Examination - Campus.

When speciﬁc freezes or controls indicate that AM is working or resolving an account issue, then coordination between CCISO and AM is needed. The issue on the account must be resolved before a request for relief can be con
sidered. This is particularly important when AM is working with an amended tax return.
(12-09-2016) Accounts Maintenance (AM) Overview
Relief from Joint and Several Liability

The claim may be received in Full Scope with an –A freeze that posted after the Innocent Spouse claim was received. The Full Scope Technician will resolve the freeze before working the claim. Suspend the claim until the -A freeze is resolved. See IRM

, -A Freeze, for additional information. If an innocent spouse claim is received on an open CCEO or AUR case, CCISO will coordinate: a. CCEO/AUR is responsible for all issues except making a determination on the innocent spouse claim. CCEO/AUR is responsible for coordinating ﬁnal case processing including issuance of a Statutory Notice of Deﬁ- ciency (SNOD), and account processing, if CCEO/AUR received the Form

, Request for Innocent Spouse Relief , from the taxpayer. b. CCISO is responsible for notifying the Non-Requesting Spouse (NRS), making the innocent spouse determination, sending determination letter(s), and providing CCEO/AUR with instructions on case closing (i.e., how to assess the tax, forward case to Appeals, etc.).

CCEO/AUR is responsible for all issues except making a determination on the innocent spouse claim. CCEO/AUR is responsible for coordinating ﬁnal case processing including issuance of a Statutory Notice of Deﬁ- ciency (SNOD), and account processing, if CCEO/AUR received the Form

, Request for Innocent Spouse Relief , from the taxpayer. CCISO is responsible for notifying the Non-Requesting Spouse (NRS), making the innocent spouse determination, sending determination letter(s), and providing CCEO/AUR with instructions on case closing (i.e., how to assess the tax, forward case to Appeals, etc.).

Note: Continuous or recurring levies may be suspended while an innocent spouse claim is pending (for example, a wage levy). Bank account, state income tax, Alaska Permanent Fund Dividend and electronic funds transfer (EFT) levies are typically a one
time levy action. Typically by the time a taxpayer is aware of a one

time levy, the action cannot be stopped. Any levy payment applied to an account after the received date of the request for innocent spouse relief, may be returned to the RS after a determination is made.
Note: If the RS indicates that the levy created an economic refer the case to TAS to make a hardship determination.
) Send a secure email including the taxpayer information for the release request to the Lead. (
) The Lead will forward the levy release request to the ACS contact. (

The CDP request or hearing must be for the RS. Notate CDP on top of the ISTSR input record sheet and place in appropriate colored folder. The ﬁnal activity on that control should be to Appeals indicating ACS sent the CDP hearing request to Appeals.

(04-06-2017) Offer in Compromise (OIC)
Note: If the OIC was for the NRS only, it has no bearing on the innocent spouse claim. Evaluate claim under normal procedures.
Listed below are OIC transaction codes and their explanation.
Do not consider the innocent spouse claim if the OIC is going to be accepted. The taxpayer can’t be considered for relief from joint and several liability for the same tax period. Issue Letter
-C, No Consid- eration Innocent Spouse. Update ISTS and ISTSR Input Record to Stage
with the activity description “UNPR ”and history comment “OPEN OIC.” If the OIC is going to be denied, document the case Activity Record and continue with claim, as per normal procedures.
Note: The taxpayer may submit another OIC if relief is not granted through the innocent spouse provisions.

) In some situations an innocent spouse determination is made by the ﬁeld the audit has closed or Centralized Case Processing (CCP) cannot process the determination. CCISO will most often receive the examination Field tive ﬁle, with a Form
, Request for Adjustment, to adjust or correct the account, or sometimes CCISO might only receive the Form
prepared a ﬁeld employee. (

) Forms that are not correctly prepared or signed must be returned to the for perfection before the determination can be processed. Completed forms sent to the Processing Team to correct or adjust the accounts. (

) TAS is an independent organization within the IRS whose employees assist taxpayers who are experiencing economic harm, who are seeking help in resolving tax problems that have not been resolved through normal or who believe that an IRS system or procedure is not working as it should. TAS protects taxpayers’ rights by striving to ensure that all taxpayers are treated fairly, and that they know and understand their rights under the Taxpayer Bill of Rights. The goal is to work efficiently with TAS. See IRM
, Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Guidelines, for more on TAS. (
) CCISO receives Operations Assistance Requests (OAR) from TAS, either mail,
ax, or secure email. Upon receipt of an OAR, hand deliver it to the CCISO Taxpayer Advocate Liaison. (
) The CCISO TAS liaison will be responsible for: a. Accepting the OAR from TAS. b. Acknowledging receipt of the OAR within
workdays (within

for expedited OARs). c. Reviewing the case for appropriate assignment. d. Inputting the OAR information on the TAS database. e. Placing the innocent spouse/TAS cases in appropriate folder (which remain around the case until it is closed to Appeals, Files or another area). f. Assigning the case to the appropriate employee within the function a Form
, Document Transmittal, if needed. (

) All cases will be worked based on the facts and circumstances of the case in concurrence with the TAS employee per the Service Level Agreement TAS. The Service Level Agreement can be found at http://tas.web.irs.gov/ policy/sla/default.aspx. Reminder: TAS cases which are marked “Expedite” will be expedited through
Relief from Joint and Several Liability
Reminder: TAS cases which are marked “Expedite” will be expedited through the innocent spouse process.
Note: Innocent spouse cases have processing time frames based on statutory requirements. The statutory time frames cannot be circumvented, even for economic burden cases.

25.15 Relief from Joint and Several Liability

Innocent Spouse claims related to Tax Court cases in CCEO, Area Office Exam or AUR require special handling and most often are claims for relief from proposed tax assessments. a. , Audit Information Management System (AIMS), for more information.

, Appeals cedures. If CCISO receives the claim for consideration, it will be worked at Appeals/Counsel’s direction with regard to taxpayer contact. See IRM
, Litigation Referral Cases, for more information.

http://www.ustaxcourt.gov/, United States Tax Court. If the RS is a Non-Petitioning Spouse (NPS): a. Work the case as normal. b. Remove the colored folder. c. , Non-Petitioning Spouse. e. On partial relief and disallowed cases, send a copy of the work papers and the allocation worksheets to the appeals office at the time of nation. a. Notify Counsel and forward claim for association with petitioned case. Request direction from Counsel on how to proceed with taxpayer contact. See IRM

a. A copy of the petition or request should be included with the referral. b. The open litigation may be the result of a petition ﬁled in response to a Statutory Notice of Deﬁciency, an open bankruptcy case, and other cases that are under a court’s jurisdiction. c. In general, a claim for relief received during Collection Due Process hearings is referred to CCISO for determination. See IRM
, for more information.
The case will typically include a memorandum addressed to CCISO as follows:
7940 Kentucky Drive, Stop 840F

Upon receipt of a referral to make a determination, call or email the Counsel attorney or officer making the referral, and ask how they want CCISO to process the referral, if it is not apparent from the referral itself. In a claim ﬁled during open litigation, work the claim with Counsel’s direction. For example: a. The Counsel attorney may want CCISO to solicit a Form

b. The Counsel attorney may request that CCISO not make contact with taxpayer and/or any third party witnesses. In these cases, the Counsel attorney will be responsible for corresponding with the taxpayer and/or any third party witnesses and for providing any missing information/ documentation to the CCISO employee. c. The Counsel attorney may request that CCISO work the claim using normal procedures for taxpayer notiﬁcations and requests for If copies of the petition and related documents, such as the Statutory Notice Deﬁciency are not in the case ﬁle, ask Counsel or the settlement officer to provide copies. Build the case on ISTS through Stage
and open TXMOD control with activity “LITIGATION”, then: a. Send Letter
-C, Non-Requesting Spouse Initial Contact, to NRS a Form
, Questionnaire For Non-Requesting Spouse, if b. Send Letter
-C, Requesting Spouse Initial Contact, to RS to any additional information needed, including Form
, if appropriate Note: Once a taxpayer ﬁles a petition in Tax Court or any court with diction, and alleges they are entitled to innocent spouse relief IRC
, a “claim” has been made. If a Form
is not with the referral, solicit one, if Counsel concurs with such a If the RS does not respond to requests for Form
or other in- formation necessary to make a determination, advise the Counsel attorney and request further instruction. Work litigation cases in an expedited manner. Make determinations within
Once a taxpayer ﬁles a petition in Tax Court or any court with juris- diction, and alleges they are entitled to innocent spouse relief under IRC
, a “claim” has been made. If a Form
is not included with the referral, solicit one, if Counsel concurs with such a request. If the RS does not respond to requests for Form
or other in- formation necessary to make a determination, advise the Counsel attorney and request further instruction.
Work litigation cases in an expedited manner. Make determinations within

days of receipt, or by the date speciﬁed by Counsel. Do not issue determination letters since the taxpayer is already in litigation, and counsel/appeals retains jurisdiction. Provide the determination (allowed, partially allowed, or not allowed) to the Counsel attorney or officer making the referral.
Document the case ﬁle with the determination. Do not send any letters, unless directed to do so by Counsel.
